TextBlock.Text: <color=lightblue>Enji</color>: I may have made it slightly convoluted for myself getting back to <color=orange>Frost Car's Core</color>, but at least I have a quick way to deal with <color=lightblue>Ghost Matter</color>.
Speaking of which, now that the train is up and running, I've made a much needed change to put the minds of the others at ease when I ride it back to show it off.

Even after going through the refinement process at <color=orange>Locomocean</color>, the fuel made with <color=lightblue>Ghost Matter</color> still leaves trace amounts of the more hazardous bits lingering in the air.
Turns out the stuff even lasts in the vacuum of space! It's coming right out of the train's whistle.
To prevent the train from pumping <color=lightblue>Ghost Matter</color> fumes out everywhere, I've set the train to blow its whistle every <color=orange>two minutes</color>.

The whistle is already continously pumping out steam to counter the <color=lightblue>Ghost Matter</color> fumes, but keeping it contained by spending a little extra water every now and then to make it completely dissipate is worth it.
